meanings.definition: A group of four bits, or half a byte.
meanings.sent1: In computing, a nybble is equal to four bits.
meanings.sent2: The computer stores data in nybbles for efficient processing.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally ate a nybble of my chocolate bar before saving the rest for later.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a nybble of sunshine in the gloomy room.
meanings.sent5: The nybble of information he shared was enough to solve the puzzle.

meanings.sent1: She had to nybble the large sandwich into smaller pieces for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The chef will nybble the cake into bite-sized portions for the party guests.
meanings.sent3: He decided to nybble his time between work and hobbies more efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The artist will nybble the canvas into sections before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will nybble the class into groups for the group project.
